extracted_news.title: MakerDAO Doubles D3M Debt Ceiling to 2.5 Billion DAI Amid High Demand
extracted_news.body: MakerDAO, the creator of the DAI stablecoin, is experiencing high demand for its product, leading to a unanimous governance vote to double the D3M maximum debt ceiling to 2.5 billion DAI. The D3M, or Decentralized Debt Markets Module, is designed to optimize DAI liquidity across different DeFi platforms by automatically adjusting DAI borrowing rates. This increase was motivated by the rapidly accelerating demand for loans at Sparklend, a sub-DAO within Maker, which saw available DAI fall to 250 million. MakerDAO recently more than doubled stability fees and the DAI Savings Rate (DSR) jumped from 5% to 15%. Stablecoin yield opportunities are rising, leading traders to swap DAI borrowed at low rates for higher yielding stablecoins. This puts pressure on DAI's dollar peg and pushed Maker's PSM module to record lows. Despite the changes, some believe the impact of new entrants like Ethena on Maker's rate increase is overstated. The sustainability of current rate levels and the future of high stablecoin yields are under discussion.

extracted_news.title: MakerDAO Announces Summer 2024 Launch of Endgame Phase 1 to Scale DAI Supply
extracted_news.body: MakerDAO has announced the launch of the first phase of its 'Endgame' in summer 2024, aiming to scale the DAI supply to $100 billion and beyond. This phase will introduce major features including new tokens, a promotional website, and strategies for user acquisition and growth. The Endgame initiative represents a fundamental transformation of MakerDAO, focusing on growth, resilience, and accessibility. Subsequent phases will focus on scaling, technical iterations, and the final realization of the Endgame vision, including the establishment of a standalone blockchain and immutable governance mechanisms.

extracted_news.title: MakerDAO's Endgame: Challenges and Potential Upgrades for MKR and DAI
extracted_news.body: Data shows that MakerDAO may face a big challenge as it plans for a better blockchain. The project's co-founder, Rune Christensen, has proposed upgrading the governance token and decentralized stablecoin DAI. However, an upgraded version may not be the solution. MakerDAO aims to scale the supply of DAI to 100 billion and more, but it has failed to impact the stablecoin market. Despite an increase in total value locked (TVL), DAI's volume has been lagging. Development activity has also decreased, suggesting a slowdown in network upgrades. Market players should keep an eye on DAI and MKR to see the potential effects of the proposal.

extracted_news.title: MakerDAO's Revenue Surges Amid Rising Interest in DAI Stablecoin
extracted_news.body: MakerDAO has been experiencing significant growth, with its revenue surpassing most Layer-1 and Layer-2 networks. This growth is largely attributed to the rising interest in its stablecoin, DAI, which has become a preferred choice for many due to the current bullish market sentiment. In response to the high demand for DAI, MakerDAO introduced an accelerated proposal for an executive vote to ensure DAI's stability. The proposal includes adjustments to stability fees, borrowing rates, and other measures aimed at managing DAI's availability and encouraging its use. Additionally, the MakerDAO network has seen a 24% increase in activity over the last month, and the price of MKR has risen by 4.77% in the last 24 hours, indicating a growing interest in the platform.

extracted_news.title: MakerDAO Implements Temporary Fee Adjustments Amid DAI Supply Drop
extracted_news.body: MakerDAO, the organization behind DAI, a dollar-pegged stablecoin, has implemented a series of temporary fee adjustments in response to a period of "increased volatility and bullish sentiment." These changes are intended to support the protocol as it sees a significant decrease in DAI's reserves. The proposal for these changes comes amid a sudden drop in DAI supply, which fell from $5 billion to $4.4 billion in the past week. The proposal was submitted by BA Labs, a member of Maker's Stability Advisory Council. Although DAI is over-collateralized, some of the collateral is tied up in real-world asset (RWA) instruments. This situation could lead to a liquidity squeeze if DAI sales continue. “Liquid stable reserves and reserves transferred to RWAs are more than sufficient to sustain the increasing pressure created by potential bull market sentiment,” the proposal states. It also highlights the issue of a liquidity crunch due to exposure to stablecoins distributed through RWAs. A number of changes have been approved to stabilize the situation and will be implemented from today. These include increasing the DAI accumulation rate from 5% to 15% and increasing the stability fees of the main vaults by approximately 9-10% each. While these changes are intended to be temporary, there does not appear to be an automatic mechanism to roll back the fees.

extracted_news.title: DAI Supply Hits New Low Despite DeFi Growth, MKR Value Rises
extracted_news.body: Stablecoin DAI has experienced a significant drop in supply since the beginning of March, reaching its lowest level since August 2023 at 4.42 million DAI. This decline occurs despite a double-digit increase in the total value locked (TVL) within the decentralized finance (DeFi) ecosystem. The decrease in DAI's supply is attributed to the protocol's collateralized debt position (CDP) model, designed to maintain its value to the U.S. dollar. High borrowing costs on MakerDAO discourage new loans and prompt debt repayment, leading to a supply drop. Meanwhile, MKR's value has grown, reaching its highest price level since April 2022, despite potential indicators of a short-term drawback.

extracted_news.title: MakerDAO Implements Temporary Fee Hikes Amid DAI Demand Shock Concerns
extracted_news.body: MakerDAO has implemented temporary changes to fees to prepare for a potential demand shock for its dollar-pegged stablecoin DAI, following a period of increased volatility and bullish sentiment. The changes, prompted by a sudden drop in DAI supply from $5 billion to $4.4 billion, include increasing the DAI savings rate from 5% to 15% and the stability fees of its core vaults by around 9-10%. These measures aim to shore up the protocol's reserves, which have diminished due to the drop in supply and potential liquidity crunch from more DAI selling. The proposal, submitted by BA Labs, a member of Maker's Stability Advisory Council, also addresses the liquidity crunch inherent in the exposure towards stablecoins deployed through real-world asset (RWA) vehicles. While the changes are meant to be temporary, there is no automatic mechanism for the reversion of the fees, raising concerns about potential market disruptions.

extracted_news.title: MakerDAO's DAI Supply Hits 18-Month Low Amid Market Dynamics
extracted_news.body: MAKERDAO’S DAI STABLECOIN HAS WITNESSED A SIGNIFICANT DECLINE IN ITS SUPPLY. THE TOTAL SUPPLY OF MAKERDAO’S [MKR] DECENTRALIZED STABLECOIN DAI, HAS FALLEN TO ITS LOWEST LEVEL SINCE AUGUST 2023, ACCORDING TO DATA FROM MAKERBURN. A DECREASE IN DAI SUPPLY STEMS FROM THE PROTOCOL’S COLLATERALIZED DEBT POSITION (CDP) MODEL, WHICH OPERATES AS A SELF-REGULATING MARKET. WHEN THE PRICES OF THE ASSETS BACKING THE STABLECOIN DECLINE, THE INTEREST RATE FOR BORROWING DAI ON THE PLATFORM RALLIES. THIS MAKES BORROWING COSTLIER, PROMPTING NEW BORROWERS TO STEER CLEAR OF TAKING OUT NEW LOANS AND MAKING EXISTING BORROWERS QUICKLY REPAY THEIR LOANS TO AVOID HIGH FEES. ALL OF THESE THEN CULMINATE IN A DECREASE IN THE OVERALL DAI SUPPLY. AMBCRYPTO OBSERVED THAT MOST OF THE DECLINE OCCURRED BETWEEN THE 30TH AND 31ST OF JANUARY WHEN DAI’S SUPPLY FELL BY 6%. FOR CONTEXT, THE STABLECOIN’S SUPPLY DECREASED FROM 5.2 BILLION TO 4 BILLION DURING THE 24-HOUR PERIOD. AT PRESS TIME, MAKERDAO’S NATIVE TOKEN MKR EXCHANGED HANDS AT $2,009, ACCORDING TO DATA FROM COINMARKETCAP. READINGS FROM MKR’S MOVING AVERAGE CONVERGENCE DIVERGENCE (MACD) INDICATOR SHOWED THAT THE BEARS REGAINED MARKET CONTROL ON THE 18TH OF JANUARY. HOWEVER, THEY HAVE FAILED TO INITIATE ANY SIGNIFICANT PRICE DECLINE. THIS IS BECAUSE THE ALTCOIN CONTINUES TO ENJOY A SUSTAINED STREAM OF DEMAND. AT PRESS TIME, ITS RELATIVE STRENGTH INDEX (RSI) WAS 56.14 AND WAS IN AN UPTREND. THIS SUGGESTED THAT WHILE A BEAR CYCLE MIGHT HAVE COMMENCED, THE BULLS CONTINUED TO ACCUMULATE MKR TOKENS. CONFIRMING THE STEADY LIQUIDITY INFLOW INTO THE MKR MARKET, ITS CHAIKIN MONEY FLOW (CMF) WAS IN AN UPTREND ABOVE THE ZERO LINE AT PRESS TIME. THE RETURNED CMF VALUE OF 0.03 WAS A SIGN OF STRENGTH IN THE MARKET. IT SHOWED THAT TOKEN ACCUMULATION EXCEEDED SELLING ACTIVITY. HOWEVER, WHILE ACCUMULATION PERSISTED, THE STATE OF MKR’S AWESOME OSCILLATOR (AO) SHOWED THE NEED FOR INVESTORS TO BE CAUTIOUS. THIS INDICATOR MEASURES THE STRENGTH AND DIRECTION OF A TREND OF AN ASSET OVER A GIVEN PERIOD. AT PRESS TIME, MKR’S AO INDICATOR RETURNED RED UPWARD-FACING HISTOGRAM BARS. THIS SUGGESTED THAT THE ACCUMULATION PRESSURE WAS WEAK COMPARED TO THE UNDERLYING BEARISH SENTIMENT, WHICH HAD A LONGER-TERM HORIZON. THIS SIGNALED THAT THERE MIGHT BE A POTENTIAL PRICE REVERSAL ONCE BUYER EXHAUSTION SETS IN.

extracted_news.title: MakerDAO's DAI Supply Recovers After December Dip as Ethereum's Value Rises
extracted_news.body:
Following a decline in its supply at the close of 2023, MakerDAO's DAI has seen a supply surge since the year began. After hitting a four-month low on the 31st of December 2023, the supply of MakerDAO's stablecoin, DAI, has witnessed a remarkable rebound in the first weeks of 2024, data from MakerBurn showed. It was found that DAI's supply had plummeted to a low of 5.22 billion DAI on 31st December 2023. This decline was attributed to the sideways movements in the price of Ethereum (ETH) as 2023 neared its end due to the anticipation around a spot ETF approval at the time.
The contraction in DAI supply was due to the DeFi protocol's Collateralized Debt Position (CDP) model. MakerDAO CDP allows its users to generate DAI by collateralizing cryptocurrencies, such as ETH. The MakerDAO CDP model maintains DAI stablecoin's value at $1 through interest rate incentives. With the year so far marked by an uptick in ETH's value, fueled by the excitement around the recent ETF approval, DAI's supply has grown. At 5.29 billion at press time, DAI's supply has risen by almost 2% from the 31st December low.
Despite the decline in DAI supply in December, user activity on MakerDAO climbed. Data from Token Terminal showed that the protocol recorded a monthly user count of 2,775 during the 31-day period, marking a 55% uptick from the 1,837 monthly users recorded in November. However, in spite of the spike in its number of users, the fees recorded totaled $15 million, declining 48% from the $28 million recorded in November. Likewise, protocol revenue saw a 48% decrease during the same window period, AMBCrypto found. Amid all these, MakerDAO has managed a 3.24% rally in Total Value Locked (TVL). According to data from DeFiLlama, the protocol's TVL was $8.83 billion at press time, making it the second largest DeFi protocol in terms of TVL, ranking after Lido Finance (LDO), with a TVL of $24.33 billion.

extracted_news.title: S&P Stablecoin Evaluation Report: USDC rated as "Strong", DAI and USDT rated as "Restricted".
extracted_news.body:
BlockBeats News, on December 13th, Standard & Poor's Global Ratings announced its evaluation of the stability of eight stablecoins, including Dai (Dai), First Digital USD (FDUSD), Tether (USDT), Frax (Frax), TrueUSD (TUSD), USD Coin (USDC), USDP, and GUSD. Analysts primarily focused on the "quality of assets supporting stablecoins." Overall quality was measured by custody risk, credit, and market value.

The evaluation results showed that USDC, USDP, and GUSD received a "strong" rating. USDT, DAI, and FDUSD received a "constrained" rating. Analysts noted that no stablecoin received the highest rating of "very strong" in this first evaluation.

detailed_analysis.title: MakerDAO Doubles D3M Debt Ceiling to 2.5 Billion DAI Amid High Demand
detailed_analysis.body: MakerDAO, the creator of the DAI stablecoin, is experiencing high demand for its product, leading to a unanimous governance vote to double the D3M maximum debt ceiling to 2.5 billion DAI. The D3M, or Decentralized Debt Markets Module, is designed to optimize DAI liquidity across different DeFi platforms by automatically adjusting DAI borrowing rates. This increase was motivated by the rapidly accelerating demand for loans at Sparklend, a sub-DAO within Maker, which saw available DAI fall to 250 million. MakerDAO recently more than doubled stability fees and the DAI Savings Rate (DSR) jumped from 5% to 15%. Stablecoin yield opportunities are rising, leading traders to swap DAI borrowed at low rates for higher yielding stablecoins. This puts pressure on DAI's dollar peg and pushed Maker's PSM module to record lows. Despite the changes, some believe the impact of new entrants like Ethena on Maker's rate increase is overstated. The sustainability of current rate levels and the future of high stablecoin yields are under discussion.

detailed_analysis.title: MakerDAO Announces Summer 2024 Launch of Endgame Phase 1 to Scale DAI Supply
detailed_analysis.body: MakerDAO has announced the launch of the first phase of its 'Endgame' in summer 2024, aiming to scale the DAI supply to $100 billion and beyond. This phase will introduce major features including new tokens, a promotional website, and strategies for user acquisition and growth. The Endgame initiative represents a fundamental transformation of MakerDAO, focusing on growth, resilience, and accessibility. Subsequent phases will focus on scaling, technical iterations, and the final realization of the Endgame vision, including the establishment of a standalone blockchain and immutable governance mechanisms.

detailed_analysis.title: MakerDAO's Endgame: Challenges and Potential Upgrades for MKR and DAI
detailed_analysis.body: Data shows that MakerDAO may face a big challenge as it plans for a better blockchain. The project's co-founder, Rune Christensen, has proposed upgrading the governance token and decentralized stablecoin DAI. However, an upgraded version may not be the solution. MakerDAO aims to scale the supply of DAI to 100 billion and more, but it has failed to impact the stablecoin market. Despite an increase in total value locked (TVL), DAI's volume has been lagging. Development activity has also decreased, suggesting a slowdown in network upgrades. Market players should keep an eye on DAI and MKR to see the potential effects of the proposal.

detailed_analysis.title: MakerDAO's Revenue Surges Amid Rising Interest in DAI Stablecoin
detailed_analysis.body: MakerDAO has been experiencing significant growth, with its revenue surpassing most Layer-1 and Layer-2 networks. This growth is largely attributed to the rising interest in its stablecoin, DAI, which has become a preferred choice for many due to the current bullish market sentiment. In response to the high demand for DAI, MakerDAO introduced an accelerated proposal for an executive vote to ensure DAI's stability. The proposal includes adjustments to stability fees, borrowing rates, and other measures aimed at managing DAI's availability and encouraging its use. Additionally, the MakerDAO network has seen a 24% increase in activity over the last month, and the price of MKR has risen by 4.77% in the last 24 hours, indicating a growing interest in the platform.

detailed_analysis.title: MakerDAO Implements Temporary Fee Adjustments Amid DAI Supply Drop
detailed_analysis.body: MakerDAO, the organization behind DAI, a dollar-pegged stablecoin, has implemented a series of temporary fee adjustments in response to a period of "increased volatility and bullish sentiment." These changes are intended to support the protocol as it sees a significant decrease in DAI's reserves. The proposal for these changes comes amid a sudden drop in DAI supply, which fell from $5 billion to $4.4 billion in the past week. The proposal was submitted by BA Labs, a member of Maker's Stability Advisory Council. Although DAI is over-collateralized, some of the collateral is tied up in real-world asset (RWA) instruments. This situation could lead to a liquidity squeeze if DAI sales continue. “Liquid stable reserves and reserves transferred to RWAs are more than sufficient to sustain the increasing pressure created by potential bull market sentiment,” the proposal states. It also highlights the issue of a liquidity crunch due to exposure to stablecoins distributed through RWAs. A number of changes have been approved to stabilize the situation and will be implemented from today. These include increasing the DAI accumulation rate from 5% to 15% and increasing the stability fees of the main vaults by approximately 9-10% each. While these changes are intended to be temporary, there does not appear to be an automatic mechanism to roll back the fees.

detailed_analysis.title: DAI Supply Hits New Low Despite DeFi Growth, MKR Value Rises
detailed_analysis.body: Stablecoin DAI has experienced a significant drop in supply since the beginning of March, reaching its lowest level since August 2023 at 4.42 million DAI. This decline occurs despite a double-digit increase in the total value locked (TVL) within the decentralized finance (DeFi) ecosystem. The decrease in DAI's supply is attributed to the protocol's collateralized debt position (CDP) model, designed to maintain its value to the U.S. dollar. High borrowing costs on MakerDAO discourage new loans and prompt debt repayment, leading to a supply drop. Meanwhile, MKR's value has grown, reaching its highest price level since April 2022, despite potential indicators of a short-term drawback.

detailed_analysis.title: MakerDAO Implements Temporary Fee Hikes Amid DAI Demand Shock Concerns
detailed_analysis.body: MakerDAO has implemented temporary changes to fees to prepare for a potential demand shock for its dollar-pegged stablecoin DAI, following a period of increased volatility and bullish sentiment. The changes, prompted by a sudden drop in DAI supply from $5 billion to $4.4 billion, include increasing the DAI savings rate from 5% to 15% and the stability fees of its core vaults by around 9-10%. These measures aim to shore up the protocol's reserves, which have diminished due to the drop in supply and potential liquidity crunch from more DAI selling. The proposal, submitted by BA Labs, a member of Maker's Stability Advisory Council, also addresses the liquidity crunch inherent in the exposure towards stablecoins deployed through real-world asset (RWA) vehicles. While the changes are meant to be temporary, there is no automatic mechanism for the reversion of the fees, raising concerns about potential market disruptions.

detailed_analysis.title: MakerDAO's DAI Supply Hits 18-Month Low Amid Market Dynamics
detailed_analysis.body: MAKERDAO’S DAI STABLECOIN HAS WITNESSED A SIGNIFICANT DECLINE IN ITS SUPPLY. THE TOTAL SUPPLY OF MAKERDAO’S [MKR] DECENTRALIZED STABLECOIN DAI, HAS FALLEN TO ITS LOWEST LEVEL SINCE AUGUST 2023, ACCORDING TO DATA FROM MAKERBURN. A DECREASE IN DAI SUPPLY STEMS FROM THE PROTOCOL’S COLLATERALIZED DEBT POSITION (CDP) MODEL, WHICH OPERATES AS A SELF-REGULATING MARKET. WHEN THE PRICES OF THE ASSETS BACKING THE STABLECOIN DECLINE, THE INTEREST RATE FOR BORROWING DAI ON THE PLATFORM RALLIES. THIS MAKES BORROWING COSTLIER, PROMPTING NEW BORROWERS TO STEER CLEAR OF TAKING OUT NEW LOANS AND MAKING EXISTING BORROWERS QUICKLY REPAY THEIR LOANS TO AVOID HIGH FEES. ALL OF THESE THEN CULMINATE IN A DECREASE IN THE OVERALL DAI SUPPLY. AMBCRYPTO OBSERVED THAT MOST OF THE DECLINE OCCURRED BETWEEN THE 30TH AND 31ST OF JANUARY WHEN DAI’S SUPPLY FELL BY 6%. FOR CONTEXT, THE STABLECOIN’S SUPPLY DECREASED FROM 5.2 BILLION TO 4 BILLION DURING THE 24-HOUR PERIOD. AT PRESS TIME, MAKERDAO’S NATIVE TOKEN MKR EXCHANGED HANDS AT $2,009, ACCORDING TO DATA FROM COINMARKETCAP. READINGS FROM MKR’S MOVING AVERAGE CONVERGENCE DIVERGENCE (MACD) INDICATOR SHOWED THAT THE BEARS REGAINED MARKET CONTROL ON THE 18TH OF JANUARY. HOWEVER, THEY HAVE FAILED TO INITIATE ANY SIGNIFICANT PRICE DECLINE. THIS IS BECAUSE THE ALTCOIN CONTINUES TO ENJOY A SUSTAINED STREAM OF DEMAND. AT PRESS TIME, ITS RELATIVE STRENGTH INDEX (RSI) WAS 56.14 AND WAS IN AN UPTREND. THIS SUGGESTED THAT WHILE A BEAR CYCLE MIGHT HAVE COMMENCED, THE BULLS CONTINUED TO ACCUMULATE MKR TOKENS. CONFIRMING THE STEADY LIQUIDITY INFLOW INTO THE MKR MARKET, ITS CHAIKIN MONEY FLOW (CMF) WAS IN AN UPTREND ABOVE THE ZERO LINE AT PRESS TIME. THE RETURNED CMF VALUE OF 0.03 WAS A SIGN OF STRENGTH IN THE MARKET. IT SHOWED THAT TOKEN ACCUMULATION EXCEEDED SELLING ACTIVITY. HOWEVER, WHILE ACCUMULATION PERSISTED, THE STATE OF MKR’S AWESOME OSCILLATOR (AO) SHOWED THE NEED FOR INVESTORS TO BE CAUTIOUS. THIS INDICATOR MEASURES THE STRENGTH AND DIRECTION OF A TREND OF AN ASSET OVER A GIVEN PERIOD. AT PRESS TIME, MKR’S AO INDICATOR RETURNED RED UPWARD-FACING HISTOGRAM BARS. THIS SUGGESTED THAT THE ACCUMULATION PRESSURE WAS WEAK COMPARED TO THE UNDERLYING BEARISH SENTIMENT, WHICH HAD A LONGER-TERM HORIZON. THIS SIGNALED THAT THERE MIGHT BE A POTENTIAL PRICE REVERSAL ONCE BUYER EXHAUSTION SETS IN.

The market has seen a 3.78% decline in Ethereum's value, with a current price of $2,378.69 and a market cap of $285.89 billion. Despite the short-term bearish trend, long-term indicators still show bullish sentiment for Ethereum.

detailed_analysis.title: Ethereum Foundation Exchanges 700 ETH for DAI and Transfers to 0x9EE for Funding
detailed_analysis.body: The Ethereum Foundation recently conducted a transaction where they exchanged 700 ETH for DAI and then transferred the funds to the 0x9EE address for the purpose of funding disbursement. The transaction was reported by BlockBeats on January 22nd, and was monitored by on-chain analyst Yu Jin. The ETH was sold for 1,684,445 DAI at a price of $2,406 per ETH. The process involved transferring the ETH to the 0xBC9 address, selling it for DAI at the 0xD77 address, and then moving the DAI to the 0x9EE address, which is used for funding withdrawals.

detailed_analysis.title: MakerDAO's DAI Supply Hits Yearly Low as MKR Value Surges Despite User Decline
detailed_analysis.body: The supply of MakerDAO's DAI stablecoin has dropped to its lowest level this year, with a steady decline since January 11th due to the fall in prices of its underlying assets. This is a result of the protocol's Collateralized Debt Position (CDP) model, which raises interest rates for borrowing when asset prices drop, discouraging new DAI creation. Despite a 40% decrease in active monthly users since December, MakerDAO has seen a 9% increase in transaction fees over the past 20 days. MakerDAO's native token, MKR, has experienced a 53% increase in value, with transactions being predominantly profitable. The token's market value is currently 40.94% higher than the average purchase price, indicating profitability for holders.

detailed_analysis.title: Ethereum Foundation Transfers 100 ETH and Converts to DAI for Ecosystem Funding

detailed_analysis.title: Stablecoin Dominance Declines as Crypto Market Value Rises, DAI Surpasses BUSD
detailed_analysis.body: The overall market value of cryptocurrencies has increased, leading to a decline in the dominance of stablecoins, with their share of the total crypto market cap dropping from 17.3% to 7.8%. Centralized stablecoins still hold a majority market share of over 90%, despite a slight year-to-date decrease in market cap. High yields have prompted stablecoins like DAI and FRAX to shift towards more centralized assets, such as U.S. Treasury bills. DAI has become the third-largest stablecoin, surpassing BUSD, and has reduced its reliance on USDC in favor of U.S. Treasury securities to mitigate risks and increase yield.

detailed_analysis.title: MakerDAO to Deprecate Native DAI on StarkNet Post-Regenesis Upgrade
detailed_analysis.body: MakerDAO has announced that the native DAI on StarkNet will be deprecated following the upcoming 'Regenesis' network upgrade. The current version of DAI on StarkNet is not upgradable and will cease to operate after the upgrade. Users are advised to transfer or migrate their DAI to the new version, which will be available through the StarkNet standard bridge, before the deployment of Regenesis.

detailed_analysis.title: MakerDAO's DAI Supply Recovers After December Dip as Ethereum's Value Rises
detailed_analysis.body:
Following a decline in its supply at the close of 2023, MakerDAO's DAI has seen a supply surge since the year began. After hitting a four-month low on the 31st of December 2023, the supply of MakerDAO's stablecoin, DAI, has witnessed a remarkable rebound in the first weeks of 2024, data from MakerBurn showed. It was found that DAI's supply had plummeted to a low of 5.22 billion DAI on 31st December 2023. This decline was attributed to the sideways movements in the price of Ethereum (ETH) as 2023 neared its end due to the anticipation around a spot ETF approval at the time.
The contraction in DAI supply was due to the DeFi protocol's Collateralized Debt Position (CDP) model. MakerDAO CDP allows its users to generate DAI by collateralizing cryptocurrencies, such as ETH. The MakerDAO CDP model maintains DAI stablecoin's value at $1 through interest rate incentives. With the year so far marked by an uptick in ETH's value, fueled by the excitement around the recent ETF approval, DAI's supply has grown. At 5.29 billion at press time, DAI's supply has risen by almost 2% from the 31st December low.
Despite the decline in DAI supply in December, user activity on MakerDAO climbed. Data from Token Terminal showed that the protocol recorded a monthly user count of 2,775 during the 31-day period, marking a 55% uptick from the 1,837 monthly users recorded in November. However, in spite of the spike in its number of users, the fees recorded totaled $15 million, declining 48% from the $28 million recorded in November. Likewise, protocol revenue saw a 48% decrease during the same window period, AMBCrypto found. Amid all these, MakerDAO has managed a 3.24% rally in Total Value Locked (TVL). According to data from DeFiLlama, the protocol's TVL was $8.83 billion at press time, making it the second largest DeFi protocol in terms of TVL, ranking after Lido Finance (LDO), with a TVL of $24.33 billion.

detailed_analysis.title: S&P Stablecoin Evaluation Report: USDC rated as "Strong", DAI and USDT rated as "Restricted".
detailed_analysis.body:
BlockBeats News, on December 13th, Standard & Poor's Global Ratings announced its evaluation of the stability of eight stablecoins, including Dai (Dai), First Digital USD (FDUSD), Tether (USDT), Frax (Frax), TrueUSD (TUSD), USD Coin (USDC), USDP, and GUSD. Analysts primarily focused on the "quality of assets supporting stablecoins." Overall quality was measured by custody risk, credit, and market value.

The evaluation results showed that USDC, USDP, and GUSD received a "strong" rating. USDT, DAI, and FDUSD received a "constrained" rating. Analysts noted that no stablecoin received the highest rating of "very strong" in this first evaluation.

Compensation will be directly based on the amount of R held in RR (Ethereum mainnet and Base) at the time of the snapshot, regardless of whether it is idle, in RR, or LP tokens. Buyers who purchased R before the second announcement on November 11, 2023, are also included. Users holding R on MEXC must provide proof of purchase of these tokens before the date of the attack incident.

detailed_analysis.body: Muun has introduced a new feature that allows users to easily top up their Lightning nodes from their phones. This feature is especially useful for users who want to connect their nodes to Muun's well-connected and well-funded nodes. The process involves generating an invoice from the node and paying it with Muun, using a submarine swap that combines an on-chain transaction with an off-chain transaction. The whole process takes approximately 40 minutes and requires four confirmations from the network. This feature provides users with outbound capacity in the Lightning Network and helps them connect to a more connected node.
